title: Explainable Graph Neural Networks for Observation Impact Analysis in Atmospheric State Estimation
abstract: arXiv:2403.17384v1 Announce Type: new  Abstract: This paper investigates the impact of observations on atmospheric state estimation in weather forecasting systems using graph neural networks (GNNs) and explainability methods. We integrate observation and Numerical Weather Prediction (NWP) points into a meteorological graph, extracting $k$-hop subgraphs centered on NWP points. Self-supervised GNNs are employed to estimate the atmospheric state by aggregating data within these $k$-hop radii. The study applies gradient-based explainability methods to quantify the significance of different observations in the estimation process. Evaluated with data from 11 satellite and land-based observations, the results highlight the effectiveness of visualizing the importance of observation types, enhancing the understanding and optimization of observational data in weather forecasting.

translated_title: 可解释的图神经网络用于大气状态估计中的观测影响分析
translated_abstract: 这篇论文利用图神经网络（GNN）和可解释性方法，研究了观测对天气预报系统中大气状态估计的影响。我们将观测和数值天气预报（NWP）点集成到气象图中，提取以NWP点为中心的$k$-跳子图。采用自监督GNN来通过聚合这些$k$-跳半径内的数据来估计大气状态。研究应用基于梯度的可解释性方法来量化不同观测在估计过程中的重要性。通过对来自11个卫星和陆地观测数据的评估，结果突出了视觉化观测类型重要性的有效性，增强了对天气预报中观测数据的理解和优化。
tldr: 研究利用图神经网络和可解释性方法分析观测在大气状态估计中的影响，通过对不同观测的重要性进行量化，提高了对天气预报中观测数据的理解和优化。
